page.title: 04Shalford School Today
page.content: During the last 50 years many changes have taken place. In 1946 a kitchen was added. Now{Mrs O'Grady, our cook, prepares about 30 lunches each day and twice a week she cooks for the{Meals on Wheels}service which supplies food to old and housebound people. The food is collected and delivered by volunteers. In 1978 the two main classrooms were made into a hall and three class areas added. The hall is now used for lunch, P.E., television and assembly. Indoor toilets were built. There is oil central heating. We have a playing field but it needs better drainage. There is a demountable room but as our numbers have fallen we are not allowed to heat it, so its use is limited. We are quite well equipped. We have a{Parent/Teacher Assoc.}which raises money for equipment. (cont p5)
